WorkItem.Description:
We plan build the uddi service one the old server farms: Windows Server 2003 + Windows SQL Server 2000
When I study the document of uddi service, 
  http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa286530.aspx
  It can download the uddi sdk version 2, but it's beta 1 
  but 
    http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa966179(BTS.10).aspx
    write :
      Note: The Microsoft UDDI SDK is not supported by or included in Microsoft Windows versions after Microsoft Windows Server 7. The Microsoft UDDI V3 SDK is included with Microsoft BizTalk Server.
 
The good news is UDDK SDKv3 Overview said:
   UDDI Services 3.0 is fully backward compatible with the UDDI v2 standard. 
 
So, I plan to code the UDDI SDKv3 sample ,
but the big problem is the SDK 3 included with biztalk ?!
I can't found any information about download UDDI SDKv3 without biztalk server 
 
Thanks
WorkItem.Summary: Using the UDDI SDK Version 3 without Biztalk

Comments.Message:
Hello hectorlee369

Thank you for using our sample request service (http://1code.codeplex.com/wikipage?title=NEW%2c%20FREE%20Code%20Sample%20Request%20Service%20from%20Microsoft%20All-In-One%20Code%20Framework) !

May I know if this is a code sample sample request? It seems that you are looking for UDDI SDKv3?

Steef-Jan Wigger (MVP):

There is a standalone installation package (http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/en/details.aspx?FamilyID=e4761835-70f0-4e8d-96c5-64818d54e06e&displaylang=en) of UDDI Services 3.0, which supports setup of UDDI Services 3.0 on Windows Server 2008 R2. It is provided to the Windows Server 2008 R2 customers, who are using UDDI Services 2.0 on Windows Server 2003 or Windows Server 2008 today to enable smooth upgrade to Windows Server 2008 R2. This package only supports Windows 7 or Windows Server 2008 R2, so if you want to use version 3 of UDDI you need to upgrade your OS, .NET Framework and SQL Server. I do not think compatibility accounts for OS or SQL you are using.

I found the UDDI SDKv3 in the "UDDI Services 3.0 for Windows Server 2008 R2" installation package.
and found the sample code in http://www.informit.com/articles/article.aspx?p=101150&seqNum=2

Thanks for your help.
